key_channel_insights.line_content: Parity fell to 55% while undercuts nearly doubled to 11.6%, signalling accelerating revenue leakage in core short-haul Canadian markets.
Metasearch was lower than the website on 91% of itineraries (-6% gap), making it the largest direct-sales threat across all regions and booking windows.
GDS shows solid parity (55%) domestically but is higher-priced on 87% of non-Canadian origin itineraries, risking share loss in overseas POS.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Identical pricing dropped to 55% of itineraries, a 6-point decline week-on-week.
OTAs now undercut the site on 11.6% of routes, up 5.8 pts, led by short-haul Canada.
Outside Canada, OTAs price 4% higher on 53% of itineraries, inflating acquisition costs abroad.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website fares absent on 8.5% of OD pairs; coverage erosion is modest but bears watching.
Same pricing shrank 5.7 pts WoW; parity deterioration is the main driver of volatility.
Average discount widened to 3–5%, nearly doubling the undercut share week-on-week.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTAs cheaper on 13.5% of domestic itineraries (-3–11%), a 12-pt jump.
OTAs higher on 36% of long-haul routes with a 2–3% premium.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Undercuts surged to 19.6% (+10.8 pts); mark-ups negligible.
53% of itineraries carry a ~4% OTA premium; undercuts rare.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Discount share rose to 13.9% (+8.5 pts) with ~4% lower prices.
OTAs higher on 24% of trips, sustaining a 5–6% premium; parity steady at 63%.

mse_highlights.line_content: Metasearch undercuts averaged 6%, putting sustained pressure on direct yields.
Exact matches doubled to 9%, but remain a small share.
Zero cases of MSE pricing above the website recorded.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 0% ‘not found’; availability is not the leakage driver.
Up 4.8 pts WoW, yet still minor versus competitors.
Price gap averages –6%, slightly narrower week-on-week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 92% lower pricing with a 5% discount; parity inching up but negligible.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity best at 16%; when lower, discount narrows to 4%.
MSE cheaper 99% of the time, with an 8% gap.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 90% of searches favor MSE by 6%; parity improving but limited.
92% undercut rate; leakage persistent across horizons.

gds_highlights.line_content: 55% of itineraries match website prices; trend stable.
Average +3% price above website, up 1 pt WoW.
87% of non-Canada markets show higher GDS fares.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 0% of website fares missing in GDS.
Movement negligible; stability contrasts with OTA erosion.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 56%; higher in 39% (+2 pts WoW); undercuts 5%.
Parity 54%; higher in 44%; undercuts scarce at 2%.
